channel.title: math.SG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Symplectic field theory: an overview
item.description: arXiv:2410.19936v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We summarize some of the main ideas and results around symplectic field theory, from its early inception up to recent and ongoing developments.
item.dc:creator: Richard Hind, Kyler Siegel

item.title: $A_\infty$ Sabloff Duality via the LSFT Algebra
item.description: arXiv:2410.20523v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We use Ng's LSFT algebra to upgrade Sabloff duality of Legendrian knots to a quasi-isomorphism of $A_\infty$ bimodules over the positive augmentation category $\mathcal{A}ug_+$. We also extend the Ekholm-Etnyre-Sabloff exact sequence to an exact sequence of $\mathcal{A}ug_+$-bimodules, using a quotient category $\mathcal{C}$ of short Reeb chords. In addition, we define curved augmentations of the LSFT algebra and show that they can be used to construct a homotopy inverse of the $A_\infty$ Sabloff map, together with all higher homotopies. The above results suggest a conjectural recipe for an explicit weak relative Calabi-Yau structure on the quotient $A_\infty$ functor $\pi:\mathcal{A}ug_+\to \mathcal{C}$.
item.dc:creator: Zhenyi Chen

item.title: Local bi-integrability of bi-Hamiltonian systems via bi-Poisson reduction
item.description: arXiv:2410.20574v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove that any bi-Hamiltonian system $v = \left(\mathcal{A} + \lambda \mathcal{B}\right)dH_{\lambda}$ that is Hamiltonian with respect all Poisson brackets $\mathcal{A} + \lambda \mathcal{B}$ is locally bi-integrable in both the real smooth case, when all eigenvalues of the Poisson pencil $\mathcal{P} = \left\{\mathcal{A} + \lambda \mathcal{B}\right\}$ are real, and in the complex analytic case. A complete set of functions in bi-involution is constructed by extending the set of standard integrals, which consists of Casimir functions of Poisson brackets, eigenvalues of the Poisson pencil and Hamiltonians.
item.dc:creator: I. K. Kozlov

item.title: Homological Lagrangian monodromy and quantum Wang exact sequence I
item.description: arXiv:2410.20677v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we study homological monodromy of a Lagrangian submanifold. First, we show that homological Lagrangian monodromy is trivial if Hofer energy of a Hamiltonian isotopy is smaller than the minimum energy of J-holomorphic spheres and discs. Next, we show that monodromy of Lagrangian Floer homology is trivial. The proof relies on a Morse or Floer theoretic approach to Wang exact sequence.
item.dc:creator: Yoshihiro Sugimoto

item.title: Regularly slice implies once-stably decomposably slice
item.description: arXiv:2410.21031v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We investigate the relationship between regular and decomposable Lagrangian cobordisms in $4$-dimensional symplectizations. First, we show that regular sliceness implies once-stably decomposable sliceness, and offer a stabilization-free strategy. On the other hand, we show that satelliting preserves regularity of concordance, suggesting that regularity and decomposability are distinct in general. Among other results, we compare the symplectic and smooth slice-ribbon conjectures and construct decomposably slice knots that may not be strongly decomposably slice.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Breen

item.title: Equivalent formulations of Hamiltonian dynamics on multi cotangent bundles
item.description: arXiv:2410.21068v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show the equivalence of different conditions on a classical field psi to be a solution of the field equations, notably in terms of the Hamilton-Volterra equations, the principle of least action and several conditions based on the contraction of the multivector tangent to psi with canonical differential forms on the multicotangent bundle. Most prominently, we have equivalence to the so-called dynamical Hamilton-de Donder-Weyl equation, that can be vastly generalized to define Hamiltonian dynamics on multisymplectic manifolds, defined for sources of different dimensions.
item.dc:creator: Maxime Wagner, Tilmann Wurzbacher

item.title: Strongly adapted contact geometry of Anosov 3-flows
item.description: arXiv:2410.21208v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We provide a 3 dimensional contact geometric characterization of Anosov 3-flows based on interactions with Reeb dynamics. We investigate basic properties of the space of the resulting geometries. A technical theorem on the expansion uniformization of adapted norms is proved, which can be of broader interest.
item.dc:creator: Surena Hozoori

item.title: Sutured ECH and Contact 2-Handles
item.description: arXiv:2410.21232v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that there are well-defined maps on sutured ECH induced by contact 2-handle attachments and that the sutured ECH contact class is functorial under such maps.
item.dc:creator: Yen-Lin Chen

item.title: Studying network of symmetric periodic orbit families of the Hill problem via symplectic invariants
item.description: arXiv:2410.21245v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In the framework of the spatial circular Hill three-body problem we illustrate the application of symplectic invariants to analyze the network structure of symmetric periodic orbit families. The extensive collection of families within this problem constitutes a complex network, fundamentally comprising the so-called basic families of periodic solutions, including the orbits of the satellite $g$, $f$, the libration (Lyapunov) $a,c$, and collision $\mathcal B_0$ families. Since the Conley-Zehnder index leads to a grading on the local Floer homology and its Euler characteristics, a bifurcation invariant, the computation of those indices facilitates the construction of well-organized bifurcation graphs depicting the interconnectedness among families of periodic solutions. The critical importance of the symmetries of periodic solutions in comprehending the interaction among these families is demonstrated.
item.dc:creator: Cengiz Aydin, Alexander Batkhin

item.title: On Lagrangian tori in K3 surfaces
item.description: arXiv:2211.00620v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Every Maslov-zero Lagrangian torus in a K3 surface has non-trivial homology class. This note aims to extend this result to Lagrangian tori with Maslov indices congruent to zero modulo 4. Conversely, we show that every homologically non-trivial Lagrangian torus is necessarily Maslov-zero.
item.dc:creator: Gleb Smirnov

item.title: Legendrian non-isotopic unit conormal bundles in high dimensions
item.description: arXiv:2410.15936v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: For any compact connected submanifold $K$ of $\mathbb{R}^n$, let $\Lambda_K$ denote its unit conormal bundle, which is a Legendrian submanifold of the unit cotangent bundle of $\mathbb{R}^n$. In this paper, we give examples of pairs $(K_0,K_1)$ of compact connected submanifolds of $\mathbb{R}^n$ such that $\Lambda_{K_0}$ is not Legendrian isotopic to $\Lambda_{K_1}$, although they cannot be distinguished by classical invariants. Here, $K_1$ is the image of an embedding $\iota_f \colon K_0 \to \mathbb{R}^n$ which is regular homotopic to the inclusion map of $K_0$ and the codimension in $\mathbb{R}^n$ is greater than or equal to $4$. As non-classical invariants, we define the strip Legendrian contact homology and a coproduct on it under certain conditions on Legendrian submanifolds. Then, we give a purely topological description of these invariants for $\Lambda_K$ when the codimension of $K$ is greater than or equal to $4$. The main examples $\Lambda_{K_0}$ and $\Lambda_{K_1}$ are distinguished by the coproduct, which is computed by using an idea of string topology.
item.dc:creator: Yukihiro Okamoto

item.title: A bordered HF- algebra for the torus
item.description: arXiv:2108.12488v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We describe a weighted $A_\infty$-algebra associated to the torus. We give a combinatorial construction of this algebra, and an abstract characterization. The abstract characterization also gives a relationship between our algebra and the wrapped Fukaya category of the torus. These algebras underpin the (unspecialized) bordered Heegaard Floer homology for three-manifolds with torus boundary, which will be constructed in forthcoming work.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lipshitz, Peter Ozsv\'ath, Dylan Thurston

item.title: Complex Symplectic Contractions and 3d Mirrors
item.description: arXiv:2406.09626v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We propose magnetic quivers for the complex-symplectic contraction spaces, which are related to implosions and have a natural interpretation in terms of the Moore-Tachikawa category. We use 3-d mirrors to provide computational checks.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Dancer, Julius F. Grimminger, Johan Martens, Zhenghao Zhong
